summary: Bohemia is the largest historical region in the Czech Republic, located in the west. It was once ruled by Bohemian kings and included areas like Moravia and Czech Silesia. Over time, Bohemia became part of different empires and was affected by wars. After World War II, it became part of Czechoslovakia, and later, in 1993, it became part of the Czech Republic when Czechoslovakia split. Today, Bohemia is still an important region, covering 52,065 square kilometers and home to about 6.9 million people.
title: Bohemia
